text: Atheradas of Laconia was an ancient Greek athlete listed by Eusebius of Caesarea as a victor in the stadion race of the 20th Olympiad (700 BC).Eusebius of Caesarea, Chronicle . After Pythagoras of Laconia he was the second Spartan to win the stadion, starting a strait of twenty Lacedaemonian titles in 150 years. == References == == See also == Olympic winners of the Stadion race Category:Ancient Olympic competitors Category:8th-century BC Spartans Category:Ancient Spartan athletes
title: Atheradas of Laconia
